topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5573bdaa6368724059000250#post_5573bdaa6368724059000250
You missed it earlier but Blissey posted a interesting scientific survey on human sexuality in the fetish thread:
"Found here":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p-A8GvUehq4

What the surveyors found out in a nutshell:
Top 2 fetishes for men:
1)Boobs
2)Shemale porn

The reason why intersex porn is so popular is that it's across cultures.  In some places men aren't interested in large butts and in some cultures men aren't interested in thin waists, etc but interest in boobs and intersex mtf women in almost universal.

That's why hentai is so popular because they crushed the competition.

topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5573bfbe6368724059000450#post_5573bfbe6368724059000450

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5573bffb6368721aec000f0a#post_5573bffb6368721aec000f0a

It's more of a reference with myself shrinking. If you could make an infinite stream of "Millimeters to millimeters to millimeters to millimeters to millimeters (etc.)", how is it possible that objects are able to achieve physical contact given that you could measure infinitesimally small distances between them and keep scaling down? 

Like (hypothetically) I was able to infinitely shrink myself, and I was on a platform beneath a weight attached by a rope that could be lowered (again, hypothetically saying I could shrink fast enough to avoid being crushed.)

If I could shrink myself no matter how close the objects got to one another, how would I be able to witness them coming into contact?

+My Family (sans EHAN):+ _
_Why do you like My Little Pony?_

+Everyone Else+:
_Forget the ponies, why do you like trains?_

+Me+:
*Because I just so happen to like that sort of thing. It's been a huge interest of mine every since I was a kid! What's so hard or foreign about it that you don't just get?*
